subject: Sleep
title: Older Adults Need Less Sleep
description: A quick win: understand Older Adults Need Less Sleep.

hook.text: People think the elderly need less sleep because they sleep less. But sleeping less and needing less are not the same.

buildup.text: Adults over 65 still need seven to eight hours. Their ability to generate sleep degrades, not the need itself.

discovery.text: Aging reduces deep sleep capacity and fragments sleep, creating a gap between sleep need and sleep ability.

twist.text: This myth causes real harm. Caregivers and doctors dismiss elderly sleep complaints because they assume less sleep is normal.

climax.text: Treating sleep problems in elderly patients improves cognition, mood, and physical health significantly.

punchline.text: Old people need sleep as much as ever. Their brains just struggle to produce it.

quiz.question: Do older adults need less sleep than younger adults?
options: No, the need stays similar but the ability to produce sleep declines
They need more sleep than young adults
